Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week and would definitely use this hotel again. Staff were friendly, the location was perfect for our purpose (shopping, touring the city), and the room was spacious and clean. Fridge and microwave in the room helped us save on our food budget (Loblaws grocery store is just a few blocks away on Queen St., and we could save our leftovers from meals out); also allowed us to supplement the not-so-great hotel breakfast with yogurt. Streetcar stops right in front of the hotel, and we were within walking distance of most things we wanted to see and do - Kensington Market, best Chinese food in the city, Art Gallery, Queen St shopping, etc. Front desk helpfully arranged for a shuttle to the airport on our last day for a 5 a.m. pick-up.

Reviews.Title: “Chinatown Super 8”
Reviews.Author: markdonadio
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, clean and reasonably priced. Smack dab in Toronto's downtown Chinatown (there are at least three other large Asian areas besides this one). The walls are a bit thin (we had trouble with a party going on in the room next to ours but the Manager made it right. The real draw to this hotel is the location. The restaurants in this Chinatown are very good. King's Noodle is always a good choice for authentic noodles in an authentically shabby Chinese restaurant. Our new favorite dim sum restaurant in this area, now that Bright Pearl is closed, is Rol San on Spadina with its variations off classic dim sum themes, excellent service and very nice atmosphere. The hotel is minute's walk from Kensington Market with its cool retro hippie vibe of vintage stores (our fave is Courage, My Love), two great bakeries, cheese shops and various groceries and culturally themed restaurants. A must visit is the redesigned and renovated Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO) also within walking distance. Don't miss the Bernini sculptures or the room dedicated to Ruben's "Massacre of the Innocents". The free and fairly frequent guided tours are fantastic. The second floor, pretty much all Canadian art and landscapes is like a walk in the wilderness. You can stay at the hotel and within fairly short walking distance spend several days in what is another world of culture, society and art.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean and Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelat2709
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel at a good price for the location. Staff were very helpful and room was kept immaculately clean. Thankyou! Would definately stay again, and reccommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel even for long stay”
Reviews.Author: Themexicancritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days, I got several rooms because I was travelling with my family. The "super 8 breakfast" is good enough to begin the day, croissants, bread, muffins, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, peanut butter, jam, butter, cream cheese and bagels, and the lady who attends there is amazing, she is short in english but she is always smiling. In the same way the rooms are always clean, and there are microwave, fridge and TV. The location is perfect, because you can walk to most of the touristic points in toronto. The service is very kind, people at front desk are very helpful, regardless the parking is $20 per day, they want you to save some bucks through different ways. Except the only lady at front desk. Who is very impatient, she has no idea about service. If you need something wait the next shift to ask, never try to solve something with her. She even tried to take advantage of one of relatives who doesn't speak english. She charge him the room & tax when I already pay. She tried to do the same with me, unfortunately for her I work in tourism and I know what to do. for this situation I asked her for the manager and she told me that there was no manager and she has no idea when she will arrive. However I will return to this hotel in a couple of months because everything was excellent but she.

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: g0bananas
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Chinatown makes it very central and convenient to shopping, transit and restaurants. This is an old section of Toronto but due to the stores opening late and people walking the streets, it was very safe. The hotel itself is on the 3rd floor of a newer building. The fridge and microwave was very convenient to have. Staff were very pleasant and helpful especially the daytime Concierge Zaeen.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Toronto for the first time over this past weekend. I did a buch of research and decided on the Super 8 in Downtown Toronto. It was fairly close to the venue we were going to, and most of the reviews I had read throughout the internet were not that bad. We arrived about 3 hours early before checkin. They upgraded our room to a kind sized jacuzzi room at no extra charge. The gentleman at the front desk- I forgot his name but he shined with his excellent customer service- helped us out by showing us a map of the city and giving us a lot of useful information. We entered the room, it was clean- the bedspread was clean and you could smell a light scent of bleach in the room, which both my husband and I liked. Everything worked well in the room. The water pressure in the shower was great. The coffee maker worked. We had to pay for parking but I was prepared for that and had budgeted for it, and it was only $20. The one elevator was not in use- but that didnt slow us down. The only complaint I have, and it isnt really the hotels fault is that the ATM in the lobby- our cards didnt work in it (we are from the US) so we went downstairs and right outside is an HSBC bank and we were able to get cash there. We were very pleased with our visit, and would stay there again. We really enjoyed the cit of Toronto. It is clean, friendly and you dont fear for your life walking down the street late at night. We cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, mouldy, weird.”
Reviews.Author: LightspeedBreifs
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not cleaned. We found dust all over floor, found several bits of food, sweet wrappers etc. The heater had lots of black mould growing in it, took me 40 minutes to clean it as the reception said they couldn't do anything about it. Black mould can be very bad for health so I didnt even use the heater in the end and we were freezing. The bed had a yellow stain on the sheet, looked like someone had urinated on it. I found around 20-odd head and 'body' hairs in the beds. The coffee machine was filthy. The bathroom had not been mopped in a long time, hairs all over the floor and mould on the silicon sealant. Half of the rooms overlook a dump of a mall, thankfully we had a view of the CN tower. Security is non-existent, anyone can walk into the hotel from the mall bypassing reception. Try a better hotel, super 8 do not care about anything but money and it shows. I heard the reception on 3 occasions dealing with complaints about not refunding peoples deposits.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great price”
Reviews.Author: MBC127
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed overnight to shop and catch a show. Underground parking garage is accessible from both Spadina (front) and Cameron (rear). Elevator from parking garage goes up to the lobby. The hotel is on the third and fourth floors overlooking Chinatown. Rooms seemed recently renovated. Everything was clean, comfortable and quiet. Desk staff was helpful in providing directions on how to use the nearby streetcar. We took the streetcar to the theatre and returned at 10:30 PM. This area seemed very safe.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - doesn't deserve the rave reviews!”
Reviews.Author: satin3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a concert at Rogers Centre. This hotel is cheap, and for very good reason. It is inside a small shopping centre in the heart of Chinatown. It is safe and quiet, but during my stay one of the elevators was broken and getting back and forth between the underground parking (basement level three) and the hotel (third floor) was very inconvenient. The lobby and decor of the hotel have been updated and look great - however the same has not been done for the guest rooms. Furniture was not in great condition and the pull-out couch in our room was dirty and useless. Breakfast isn't special. Parking is very inconvenient and hard to find. I had to drive around the hotel in order to get to it after I missed it the first time. It states that Hotel parking is on the third and lowest level - I figured because it specified the third level was for hotel patrons that we would get some kind of a deal. Be warned - you don't! So do yourself a favour - park on level one and save yourself some elevator/parking time. The only thing I was impressed with was the free wi-fi - something you don't often get in the nicer Toronto hotels for free. Location was also very convenient - $7 cab ride from Rogers Centre. Would I stay here again? Yes. But only in a pinch. Do yourself a favour and spend a little extra and stay somewhere closer to the Yonge/University-King area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jessica T
Reviews.Content: Receptionist staff are very friendly and helpful. My boyfriend and I had checked in last minute and were still able to find a room. Great internet connection and a nice breakfast in the morning however I would of preferred a cooked breakfast. Rooms are spacious and clean but the bathroom wasn't up to standards. Overall nice motel for the money and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: SKY17
Reviews.Content: Good price, perfect location and plus we got free parking...for no reason, which was a good surprise for us! Nothing bad coming to my mind to comment about this place. For the money we paid, we got a bit more we expected!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Asian food lovers”
Reviews.Author: nkdiaz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a king double which was nicely positioned with a view of the CN Tower. The room was comfortable with TV, Microwave, Fridge. One major amenity for us is having acces to wifi, this was an issue as the signal strength for connecting from our room was non existent. We had to request an Ethernet cable which resolved the issue for us but I did see other guests sitting in the lobby to connect from there. Not a life or death issue but if it is not available in room then it should not be advertised that it is. If you love Asian food this hotel is in the best location, we enjoyed some really well priced Vietnamese & Thai food only a stones throw from the front door of the hotel. Right next door there is an Asian shopping centre with a foodcourt at the base level with 4 dollars meal deals, that value can't be beat for a tasty lunch. There are some lively bars & venues located on College st. Which are just 15 min. Walk from the hotel and you can stroll through Kensington (lively bright area with lots of cafes & shops) to get to College st. A good breakfast is on offer including bagels, apples, oranges, cereals, condiments, muffins, juices and some good coffee. There is a bar onsite although it's small it's nice to have it there if you don't want to venture out but are in the mood for a beer.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to spend a night.”
Reviews.Author: AEP283
Reviews.Content: By no means is this a SPECTACULAR place to stay. But if you're in Toronto for a night out on the town, a wedding, or another function where you're not spending a lot of time in your room ... then the Super 8 will suffice. They allowed me to have an early check-in, which was extremely helpful as I was in a wedding party that day. I DID have to call a week before, the morning of, and the hour before I got there though to ensure they had a room ready for me. (They kept telling me to call back). It also comes with a decent continental breakfast which consisted of bagels, muffins, cereal. I just wish it had some fruit!

Reviews.Title: “Great times!”
Reviews.Author: Dragongirlmi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and bright. It's location in chinatown is only six blocks from anywhere and the trams pick you up right on the corner! It was an excellent stay and we will use this hotel and location again!

Reviews.Title: “great location for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: lowflyingcat
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed here for 3 nights i early Sept. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. Two queen beds that were very comfy with pillows to match. Location was perfect for us, with street cars stopping right outside on a major street (Spadina ave) and an easy walk to shops. Breakfast was cereal or porridge, toast and muffins yes basic but easy to fill up on. Our only complaint was that the hot water was hit and miss and sadly for me more of a miss with only one hot bath and lukewarm showers in our 3 days stay, with front desk staff very uninterested in sorting our problems. But saying that we would still return and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed!”
Reviews.Author: scotiangirl194
Reviews.Content: First impression was o.k, seemed clean, check-in was quick. You have to pay $10.00 for parking. Our room was 8417 and the cost for 2 adults and 2 children for one night was $203.26. The room was very large, but the bathroom was small. Two queen size beds and a pull-out. Right away, I noticed there were two blue balloons behind the pull-out, along with an inch layer of dust next to the baseboard. There was also tape on the wall, where, I assume, the balloons were from. I wasn't impressed. Also the beige carpet wasn't very clean at all, white socks proved that! The beds were clean and comfortable. There was a weird set-up at the back of the room, past the beds, sort of like a sitting area, but drab and depressing. Windows looked out upon run-down apartment buildings. Free wi-fi, but only worked near the check-in counter, not in room. Complimentary breakfast was nothing special, we did not stay, but I did see people eating green apples, bagels, cereal, coffee, juice. I would not stay here again, just was lacking something, I felt closed in, not what I'm used to I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mardia2011
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely clean rooms. Cannot fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Super-8 In Toronto's Chinatown District”
Reviews.Author: bgluckma
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal (thanks, Hotwire!) on this well-located and clean property in the Chinatown District of Toronto. Parking is located in a lot directly under the hotel, but with all of the other signs in the area, you may have to look carefully to find the entrance to the underground lot. The hotel itself sits over a shopping center and food court (I wouldn't recommend the food court). You'll need to take the elevator to the Super 8's lobby. The hotel provided me with a parking pass so I could freely leave and re-enter the parking lot at no extra charge (which I believe is a fair-enough $10/day for Toronto). This property was a nice surprise for us. Check-in was relatively easy and efficient. Our room, on the same floor as the lobby, had a large jacuzzi bathtub IN THE BEDROOM. I'm assuming this room was a honeymoon room or something. At any rate, the in-bedroom bathtub was functional, but the jacuzzi function was not. The room had a king-sized bed, a decent TV, a microwave and a fridge. Have no fear, in addition to the in-bedroom bathtub was a regular tub/shower in the bathroom which was clean. Unfortunatetly, I give the shower only 1 star out of 3 stars. The water pressure was okay, but the drainage was slow, and I couldn't figure out how to get the water warmer than tepid. Our room faced the smaller, and much-less busy street at the back of the hotel was very quiet. I assume that rooms facing Spadina Street in the front, may be much noisier. The complimentary breakfast was nothing to write home about, typically "continental" style with no hot food available. But plenty there to choose from to get your day going (breads/fruit/coffee/juice/cereal). If you use the public transport in Toronto, the streetcar stop is conveniently located right across the street from the hotel. Overall, no complaints and a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: PeterDCanada
Reviews.Content: We loved being right in the centre of China Town. Rooms were spacious, clean and excellent value for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy hotel, good location and affordable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chavez_Ravine
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Super 8 Chinatown last summer (July 2010) and, in general, it was a good experience. We had booked 3 nights over the net and our room was available upon arrival. We drove a rental car there, and it was great that they allowed us to park for an hour or so without charging us, so we could check in, leave our luggage and go return the car. Since itâ€™s located on Spadina Ave., itâ€™s easily accessed by foot, by public transportation or by taxi. Queen, King and Dundas avenues are easily accessed from this hotel. As everyone has mentioned, it is located in a mall, but we didnâ€™t mind, as we were looking for a clean and comfortable place to sleep after walking the city, not a room with a view that we would not even have the time to enjoy. The only backdrop to our trip was that the air conditioning in our room was broken. Staff was diligent and nice, but told us there were no additional rooms available, so we had to sleep with a small fan, which only circled the same warm air we were already breathing. However, they did change us into a spacious room the next two nightsâ€¦ one of the rooms located right next to the reception desk (nice reception, BTW). It had big windows from where you could see the CN Tower. There was a small cafeteria where you could get coffee and juice and cold cereal. Get up early though, it doesnâ€™t last long.

Reviews.Title: “More that I expected”
Reviews.Author: LePierre-Luc
Reviews.Content: It is supposed to be a 2 Two-Stars, but I think it could be a 3-Stars. The room is bigger than I expected. There is real view... In fact, you can see inside a shopping mall! (But it is somewhat funny). The location is excellent. You have everything you need. The room was very quiet, since the shopping mall is closed at night. Everyone was super sweet to us. I wanted an hotel just for the location, it has done it, and even more.

Reviews.Title: “A-1 If You Hate Spending Money”
Reviews.Author: Edm0nd
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here on business. The review below by "w0rldwise" nailed it. This is a completely safe, inexpensive and unexciting hotel frequented by tour buses and German backpackers. The Kensington Market is nearby, and the few city restaurants where two can eat for under $25. It is on the Spadina streetcar line with excellent transit access, and within walking distance of the ballpark and stock exchange. Avoid the place if you're fussy, or freak out everytime a hobo asks you for a smoke. I'd take the kids here, but they're not particular. There aren't many hotels like this left in downtown TO.

Reviews.Title: “Man Eating Elevator of Death”
Reviews.Author: CatalystPromotions
Reviews.Content: In May, Spartan Youth Radio, Canada's only high school podcast radio station, sent a crew to attend a conference in Toronto. We stayed at the Super 8 Downtown and, though the hotel was decent, the mall it was housed in was filthy, smelly, seedy and in poor repair. There was vomit in the front vestibule to get upstairs. Homeless men were passed out outside the front door. The air conditioning could only be turned on to a maximum of 20 degrees. And, the kicker...the elevators seldom worked. In fact, at one point, we made the long trek down a urine-soaked stairwell to find that the elevator wasn't working and that the doors were askew, hanging on by a single strip of metal. We thought this would be an incredible topic for a streeter. You can watch it at http://spartanyouthradio.com or http://youtu.be/ui0WjTMFhI8

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: smedly16
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Hotwire for a great price. The location was right in Chinatown and very safe. Also the local food in the area was fabulous and cheap compared to other areas in Toronto. Staff were fine. Nice lady in the breakfast room, she keeps it nice and clean. I recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget who doesn't have huge expectations on luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly experience, Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rye2424
Reviews.Content: My stay started bad and didn't get any better, Parking is on the third floor under a shopping mall and the elevator didn't work, We had to take 2 different flights of stairs to get to the street level of the mall. Then there were no signs to get to the hotel, we had to walk around the outside of the mall to find the doors for the hotel, then take an elevator to the 3rd floor to get to the lobby, When we came back at night we got locked in the mall and couldn't get out till the security guard showed up to unlock the door to the street. The second night we had to walk up the car ramp 3 floors up so we could avoid getting locked in the mall. Rooms where dirty, pubic hair in the bed and bathroom, old food in the fridge that smelled really bad, stains on everything, bed, chair, curtains, rug. Very rude old lady yelled at me when i tried to bring a muffin from the continental breakfast area to my room for my Spouse. Has to swipe card to get to 4th and 5th floor that never worked, it would bring us to the street level then back to the 3rd floor, 6 cards in 2 days. This stay at the hotel ruined my trip. I will never stay at a Super 8 ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we moved to another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Silknsaber
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant when my friends had told me they booked The Super 8 after I read all the bad reviews. Upon arrival I was concerned with the location of the motel as it is located in Chinatown on top of a mall? You have to enter the mall and then take an elevator to the first floor. The lobby was ok. It looked clean and the staff at the front desk were friendly. The room was very outdated! All the furniture looked very old and damaged! Upon inspection of the bed, the mattress cover was full of hair and looked dirty. The sheets had a big hole in it. Within 10 minutes of inspecting my room, my friends called and said they wanted to change hotels as they found 2 cockroaches in their room, on the desk and wall! We went down to complain to the front desk staff and they offered my friend another room. When we went to inspect the other room, the lights did not work at all!! We decided we had enough and got out of there quickly! Luckily I was able to get another 2 rooms at the Holiday Inn on Bloor Street instead! I do not recommend staying at the Super 8 in Chinatown, Toronto!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Clean BUT....”
Reviews.Author: miketash
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in downtown toronto and in close relation to everything. The room and hotel is clean and the staff are friendly but .. The walls are paper thin... We heard everything and there was a room either next to us or above us where there was constantly banging and crashing. Constantly. We went upstairs to investigate and we thought that it may have been a utility room. But constant noise. The first night they allowed young kids to have a party in the rooms next to us which was true hell but give compliment the staff who after many complaints from many guests shut the party down at 11pm. Also WIFI was free but extremely bad connection unless you were sitting in the lobby. I would recommend if you are money conscious and happy to get an average clean hotel otherwise look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice!”
Reviews.Author: Darth_Vukster
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Toronto for one night and were looking for somewhere to stay that was within walking distance of the ACC (downtown area). Were were trying to balance quality and price. Typically we like to keep our cost around 100. The pics and location seemed good from the description on various travel websites, so we took a shot. We were hesitant to begin with because our first thought was "Super 8 motel"? Who wants to stay at a motel? Let me assure you that this is NOT a motel...it is Super 8 HOTEL" As we pulled up we realized that this place was right in the heart of Chinatown! At that point we were not sure whether that was good or bad. It was a windy day and there seemed to be quite a bit of trash blowing around. In addition, there was graffitti on quite a few buildings (most). Again, this made us wonder if we made the right choice. As it turned out, we never felt "unsafe" during our walk to and from the ACC. We returned to the hotel around 11-12 at night and there were still people walking around and we were never uncomfortable. When we first arrived to the front of the hotel, we found that it was in the middle of a block, and didn't really have anywhere to pull over to check in, or even drop anyone off. Luckily traffic was light and I was able to briefly stop and my wife jumped out to go inside and register. I continued on and drove around the block. I later found that there was a parking garage located beneath the hotel (and mall) that had access from a side street behind the hotel. Had we known, we could have just pulled directly into the parking garage (Chinatown Parking Garage?) and gone inside to check in from there. Parking was on ten, which I thought was quite reasonable, as we have stayed at places that charge up to thirty. Once I found the proper place to park (P3 - indicated by small signs), I grabbed our stuff and headed to the elevator. As it turns out, this hotel is located above a mall. There is a neat glass elevator that you take to the 3rd floor where the hotel lobby is located. Entering the lobby were were quite pleased to see that is was relatively modern, clean, and up to date. After checking in, we proceeded to our room. It was a King, and included a small fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. It was clean, had plenty of room, had a dresser, desk, tv stand, two nightstands, luggage stand, side table, and shelf for coffee maker. I was quite impressed with everything we got for under a hundred. And to top it off, breakfast was included. It wasn't anything great, but it was breakfast none the less (continental), saving us the time and cost of going somewhere else to eat. All in all I thought this place was very nice. The staff was very nice and helpful. At breakfast, when the line was getting backed up at the two toasters, they even went back and pulled out another one to try to reduce the wait. The place is well kept, relatively modern, clean, quiet, and safe. I would absolutely return myself, as well as recommend this place to anyone who isn't looking for a "high end" three hundred dollar room. Also, it is only a couple streets over from Young and University, if you are looking to walk those streets.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever! Never Go HERE! Spend the extra money and get quality!”
Reviews.Author: spencertmiller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst experience we have ever had with a hotel. We had a flooded toilet when we got the room at 6pm. We noticed it and called about it at 7pm, and was told that "The maintenance working is done for the day but they can give us a plunger for US to do it ". We are trying to have a good time and wait until 10pm, still nothing. So we go out and think, 'maybe they will fix it or give us a plunger by the time we get back'. We get back 2am. Talk to the guy at the front desk.. The man says " We don't have a plunger".. So the girls ask " May we use the public washroom or staff?" Front desk- " No, we don't have a public toilet nor can I let you use the staff" Girls- "Where do we go the restroom if we can't go in our room and you cant fix it?" Front desk- "McDonalds is down the street 5 minute walk.. Go there or you'll have to wait for the morning." I have never been so disappointed or surprised in my life to be treated so poorly. I ever later read reviews that it is known for serious bed bug issues. I recommend you put the little extra money out and spend it at a hotel that isn't so dirty and knows what customer service actually means.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest, but could have been a lot worse”
Reviews.Author: kell0548
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Downtown Toronto. It is within walking distance of a number of attractions: the Rogers Centre, Art Gallery of Ontario, Hockey Hall of Fame, Roy Thomson Hall. The room was clean and everything in the room worked just fine too. I'd say my biggest issue was with the so called amenities. There was only WiFi in the lobby and certain rooms (not mine). The connectivity of the wireless was marginal at best. Also, the free breakfast: I only ate it on the first morning I was there. The freezer burned croissant was enough to turn me off.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect too much for little”
Reviews.Author: MOJEWL
Reviews.Content: Ok for the money. Room was big enough given that we only needed it to sleep for 2 nights. Location was very good and I felt as if I was in natural suburban surroundings, not necessarily a vacation spot. Parking was excellent and could easily find different kinds of food. Took bus to train right outside door. Only setback was it was not really clean, bathroom was clean but covering on bed was not .Slept on top.( I always travel with lysol and disinfectant). Corridors needed to be clean and aired out. Forget about breakfast or pool not worth time. Pictures are not of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby...”
Reviews.Author: faajj
Reviews.Content: Cheapest hotel we could find within walking distance of everything. Room wasn't great, but good enough. Had 2 queens and a pull-out so I had a bed, as did my 2 teenage sons. Breakfast was adequate as the boys filled up with cereal and fruit and didn't have to eat until late in the day. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: busymom088
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two children, ages 14 and 12yrs, stayed here in Chinatown for 4 nights in July. It was our first time in Toronto and we were concerned about being so close to downtown, especially at night--- but we had no worries once we were there-- lots of families around, and didn't feel "unsafe" at all. The rooms were clean, lots of room, and the fridge/microwave was a great help... we also had great service from front desk, even though the weekend we were there it was very busy-- they still got us checked in early, and were eager to help us with directions, etc. We were lucky enough to have the first room next to the main lobby, which I thought was going to be very noisy, but with the air conditioner going, we had peaceful, quiet nights all along! An added bonus was that we were right next to the kitchen area, so breakfast was quick and easy- no frills however-- standard continental fare-- the beds were super comfy - even the shower was great! Another perk, there is actually a spa located in the hotel, so I got a shiatsu massage and pedicure just two doors down the hall from our room! very good prices... location is perfect... close to streetcar routes and walking distance to lots of main streets. I would highly recommend staying here...rates are excellent. My only complaint is that there was no pool, and parking may be tangly for anyone with a car, but that's due to the one way streets, and trying to find a way in, but otherwise, it seemed ideal for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, possibly a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: amieo
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I, were pleasantly surprised to find that the lobby and room were very clean, after reading some other reviews on TripAdvisor. My friends had booked and paid for a room for three people, with a king bed and pull-out couch, for $150 US (including tax). When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that they were putting an extra $100 safety deposit on the bill (which we were not told about previously). Although we were told the next day at check-out that this would be removed immediately, they never verified who was checking the rooms to actually see if any damage was done, or verified that they knew of any damage that was already found in the room. PARKING: The staff at the front desk seemed really unsure of how much the parking would cost. There is a parking garage essentially behind the hotel, but also used for the mall customers so you can either pay through the hotel or the parking garage; I believe the hotel charges $19 plus "extra fees" for one night. The sign on the garage says 30 minutes ($2), 8a-6p ($8), 6p-8a ($6), max weekend rate ($10). My friends and I parked on Friday night at 4p and left Saturday at 7p and were charged $30 through the parking garage (so we are unsure of how you actually get the max weekend rate). There is no one working in the garage to ask about the rates, just a machine. INTERNET AND CABLE:There is a computer in the lobby for people to use but the internet never worked the two days we were there and there was no printer. We were told that we could get internet in the room, and were given an ethernet cord to use for free as we were told we would not be able to get wireless. After a few hours of the ethernet not working, we were able to collect to a wireless network in the room through the hotel. There was a cable television in the room with about fifty channels. BREAKFAST: The free continental breakfast included bagels, muffins, croissants, three types of cereal, orange and apple juice, and milk. Breakfast is served from 6-10a, we arrived at 9, and everything seemed well stocked. ROOM: There is a small refrigerator and a microwave in the room. My friends and I booked a room for three people, with a king bed and pull-out couch. Unfortunately, we were only given two bath towels and two pillows in the room, which was disappointing as the hotel was told there would be three people staying in the room. There is an air conditioning unit in the room, but even though it was turned to full blast and freezing cold the air only circulated about one foot away from the unit (the room was hotter than it was outside and the windows are not able to be opened). LOCATION: The hotel is attached to a tiny Chinese mall, however to use the elevator to get to the hotel room floors you have to have a hotel key. There is only one elevator and it takes at least a few minutes to arrive to your floor. The hotel also seems to be in a fairly safe and quiet neighborhood. It's about a twenty minute walk to the CN Tower or to the ROM, and the subway and streetcars can be taken right on Spadina as well. There are restaurants, bars, and small stores all along Spadina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Heart of Toronto Shopping”
Reviews.Author: nikkimet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the super 8 in chinatown on a booking with Hotwire.com, it was advertised as a 2 star hotel. This is a great location in the middle of the chinatown shopping district, close to Kensington market and a short walk to Queen St for shopping. There was lots still going on in the area late after a concert on a Saturday night. The Hotel area was good, the lobby was bright and clean and contained a computer with free internet access as well as a small dining area for the continental breakfast served until 10 am. The front desk staff was helpful and was able to direct us on which street cars to take. We caught the street car by the hotel and it took less than a half hour to get to Ontario place, and was a 15 dollar cab ride to return. The rooms were a good size and well appointed, microwave and bar fridge was useful! We were a little nervous with the set up of the rooms a bit as the hallways are a bit maze like and a little dark and our room (3418) was located in a dark corner and also had sun lights (which the hotel states are not in every room) instead of windows which affected our ability to sleep in..... Overall the hotel was a great location with plenty located near by to do, the rooms were clean and had all you needed for a great stay in Toronto, I would stay here again, but ask for a different room

Reviews.Title: “It's all good! Location, room and service”
Reviews.Author: cheflynn50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and wanted to be within walking distance for a concert at Rogers Centre without spending $250 (or more) a night. We had a 2 queen suite with a fridge and micowave. It was huge! There was a sleep couch and coffee table sitting area. Dining area (2 chairs and a table) by itself could have been a room. A/C and good sized TV- all worked well. Clean and new room and bath. Little sparse furnishing (few dresser drawers) but great space for 4 -5 people. Asked for some extra towels and they arrived in minutes. We were on the 4th floor over a Chinese mall. Found some great stuff looking around. The area outside seemed very safe, even at night and there was a man every morning cleaning up the square outside. Used your room key to get to your floor in the hotel. Had some great food in Chinatown and walked to Kensington Market - unusual finds there. Parking was underground- elevator to lobby, Pd about $18 a night but was cheap compared to everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Area & Room = Dirty”
Reviews.Author: RarelyPostReviews
Reviews.Content: Definitely in Chinatown - hotel is on 3rd floor of Chinese flea market. Area is dirty. Previous guests' items were left in our hotel room (which means it wasn't cleaned properly), and bathroom was disgusting - previous guests' hair still all over bathroom and grime was in sink, counter, toilet and shower. Our tiny partial-window at the top of one wall had a view of another wall. Parking is $21+ per night. Elevators take forever. Breakfast (6-10am) was not ready at 6am, or even fully available at 7am. Restaurant guide in hotel room is either incorrect or out of date. You can hear guests in adjacent rooms and rooms above.

Reviews.Title: “Second time Just as Good...great location”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser51
Reviews.Content: Stayed first week of July for 3 nights with wife and son. We were there to see Toronto Blue Jays play Minnesota 3 games, Blue Jays won 2!! Yeah. We stayed year before, so there was nothing steering us away from this hotel. This year we arrived a few hours early and asked receptionist Olivia if there was any chance we could check in early, she did point out politely that we were 4 hours early, however if we could wait she would check. Approximately 10 - 15 minutes later after it seemed she changed a few hotels keys, she allowed us in our room early. Thankfully because it was approx 30 - 34 degrees outside very hot and muggy. The room was nice 2 queen beds, clean and the beds were very comfortable. Everything worked well in the room, and our view was of the CN tower. The continental breakfast was a great start, I have seen other reviews where they ran out of stuff... this never happened for this stay or previous stay, there was an older pleasant lady always refilling and cleaning. The Hotel is very affordable and centrally located, one of the best features is location in the heart of Chinatown, the people and culture are very quiet and even late at night walking back from Rogers Centre we felt very safe. When we return to Toronto will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gavin23
Reviews.Content: The service of the hotel was terrible. I went to the Super 8 Downtown Toronto in June 2010 and stayed there for 2 nights. The first night, I found out that the bed sheet was dirty with some disgusting stained on it, and I brought it to the receptionist, asked for an exchange, but his attitude was very bad, he even accused me of dirtying the bed sheet, didn't admit that the house cleaning is not doing their job. And even asked me to bring the dirty bed sheet back to my room because the room service lady was off work, and he didn't want to take care of that for me. And in the second day, the roof of my room was leaking water. I will never ever go back to this hotel again. Get away from this hotel, it spoiled your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “2-Star, at best!”
Reviews.Author: lwbadgr
Reviews.Content: The hotel access is limited. Many doors are locked, or otherwise inaccessible (unknown if this was due to G8/G20 summit). The room was large, but dated. The floor was incredibly uneven, with varying heights which made walking on it difficult, especially when you are half asleep. The mattress was uneven, and my wife complained that she kept rolling towards the center. The pillows were very "full" and I need a flat pillow, which they didn't have. We both suffered from stiff necks as a result. Cleanliness was not the greatest either. About the only thing this hotel has going for it is it's high-speed internet and location. There are streetcars available right outside the door, or it's only a +/-20min walk to the CN Tower or Roger's Centre. It is situated on top of 3 floors of mall shops, and a food court.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value on Edge of Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: Forget the name "Super 8" and its "two-diamond" rating from AAA--this place is a place with solid three-star comfort and four star value. A 5 minute taxi, ten minute tram, or 20 minute walk to the center city, this place is an excellent alternative to overpriced conference hotels, with free wifi AND free hardwired connections, and rooms with amenities like coffeemaker, microwave and fridge. Only downside--nowhere obvious to buy a takeaway six pack, but I'm sure the friendly staff would point you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better, seen worse - about average.”
Reviews.Author: Loncat
Reviews.Content: We booked this as part of a package through Thomas Cook. As always we checked the reviews on here first and they seemed pretty ok. We arrived early and the room wasn't ready, we left our bags and went off for a wander. Came back 2 hours later, room ready. It was on the 3rd floor, which is also where the reception is. (There is a doorway onto the main street, you go in to a small lobby and take the elevator up to the 3rd floor. A little strange, but no trouble). We had room 8317, right in the far corner. It was very large, with an enormous king bed, desk, large TV, small fridge, coffee machine and microwave. Room and bathroom really clean and tidy. Towels soft, but pretty holey and tired. This week has been incredibly hot, breaking lots of Toronto records, so the air con in the room has been a very welcome feature. However, it is really noisy! One of the good points about the hotel is that it is fairly central. Really close to the trolly/tram system which you can use to get around the city. There are Chinese shops and restaurants everywhere. A cab to the jumping areas. like Yonge\Dundas Square where the big shopping centre is will cost you about $8. Not too bad. The breakfast is okay. Bread, bagels for toasting. Muffins, oranges, juice, porridge, cereal and tea or coffee. Not very exciting, and stuff ran out pretty regularly. Also the breakfast area is not big enough for the amount of people in this busy hotel. We gave up a couple of times. Also, we witnessed rude Europeans, (we are also Europeans so not biased), taking way more food than was necessary, filling pockets and drink containers even though there were signs asking you not to. Can't say I was surprised, just embarrassed. Some of the reception staff were rude, one guy I can think of especially. However, there was a lovely girl on reception most days who was helpful. The maids were a bit lax on some things, we had to chase them to leave us loo roll, tissues, etc. (Apparently one roll a week should be ample!). But that is only a minor hassle. On balance the hotel is pretty average for a big city 2**.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay At this Location”
Reviews.Author: rdr49
Reviews.Content: We were back to this hotel after being guests almost exactly one year ago. We booked it on Hotwire for $85 US, final cost with taxes and fees was $102.74 US. Unlike other return guests who have reviewed recently, we found conditions much the same as before and we were quite satisfied. We arrived around midnight, on foot from Union Station (about 2 km away - we could have taken the 501 Spadina Street car). Check-in was friendly and efficient. The room was clean and very large. Washroom this visit was large too. Bed was a king-size unit and quite comfortable. The free continental breakfast next morning was basic but good and very convenient. Check-out was problem free. A couple of cons: I found and turned on the climate control on this stay. It was a litle noisy through the night. Hot water volume and temperature in the shower in the morning was just borderline acceptable...but still okay. My wife who is fussier than I am said that while Hotwire rated it as only a 2-star location, she would give it 2.5 stars, or even 3 if the shower water has been better. I'd give 3 myself, regardless of the hotwater.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i have ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: sillythetourist
Reviews.Content: To begin with i was greeted with 'hello... you are exteremly early"... it was 2.30 pm and i had requested an early check in. My resevervation had been lost, and took over an hour to resolve, the man at the front desk kept muttering under his breath 'jesus christ! [--]!' which is completely unprofessional. I had a print out of my reservation which was booked through the super 8 website, yet this did not help the situation. He kept saying 5 more minutes, an hour later he had upgraded my room, when i hoped into bed that night there were still crumbs in the sheets. House keeping cleaned our room twice and i had left the 'DO NOT DISTURB' sign both mornings when we left the room! The last day room service tried entering the room with out even knocking at 9 am!! On my last day as i was checking out the front desk man, asked 'how will you be paying for this'. I told the man it has already been payed for and on my reservation sheet it states 'full amount charged at the time of booking' the man continued to argue with me stating 'i had not paid' and that is a typo???? even though the money had already been taken from my credit card... i ended up walking off as i was late for my bus. when i got to a computer i checked my credit card statement, the charge for the hotel was charged to my credit card on the 19/05, and he was arguing with me on the 21/05 (when i checked out) stating i had not yet paid, he was completely rude, and spoke to me as if i was stupid. The absolute worst experience i have ever had with a hotel, all due to the service and incompetence of the staff at the front desk, i would never stay with the super 8 chain again due to the experience i received at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much worse than I remember.”
Reviews.Author: zw2l
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. The bathrooms were dirty, and there were stains on the furniture, walls, and doors. Not only were the bathroom towels tiny, but they were so threadbare that they had holes in them. The hotel staff were not accommodating at all. I asked for an extra pillow and they told me they didn't have any. (What kind of hotel runs out of pillows?) They also denied my request for a late checkout- I think this is the first time that ever happened to me. They also try to scam you on the parking. If you pay for parking through the hotel it's $19, but if you just pay through the attendant in the garage its $8-$16 depending on when you checkout. We stayed here once before two years ago, and we were pleasantly surprised (I think that was just after a remodel). However, we were very disappointed when we went back. It seems as if they haven't done anything to maintain the property in the last two years. The hotel is cheaper than others in downtown Toronto, but not by much. You can find much better hotels for slightly more, which would be in much better neighborhoods. This hotel might be worth $50 a night, but at over $100 a night, its a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not a 2 star.....”
Reviews.Author: Mlee21
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you pay for what you get, and other times you pay for what you get but receive so much better. This hotel falls into the second category. Super8 Downtown Toronto is not a 2 star hotel. It should be a 3 star at least. A group of 5 of us went and stayed in 3 rooms. The views is the only problem we encountered. Our room was lucky enough to have a view of the CN Tower, the other rooms were not so nice (one with the view of the inside of a shopping mall - pls message me for photos of views). The location is great, right outside tram stops and the choices of food within the vicinity (mainly chinese / vietnamese due to the hotel located in the heart of Chinatown) is excellent. Couldn't fault the amneties inside the room. The rooms were huge and was easily nicer than the Crown Plaza I stayed in at Niagara Falls (which room alone there cost 10% of my whole flight and stay at Super8). Fully recommended. MSG me if you want more details on the place. Ooops, one downside........Only wired internet in the rooms works very well, the wifi isn't reliable but when you do manage to connect it's quite good. Never had breakfast as I was always too tempted to go eat in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel rooms I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: sacral
Reviews.Content: Super 8 hotel on Spadina Ave, Toronto was a pleasant surprise! Pros: Awesome, excellent spacious rooms with fresh scented air. My room had a jacuzzi too..!! Decent complimentary AM breakfast. Cons: Parking space (very crowded and hard to find), location (amidst not-so-clean chinatown) and parking fee ($20/day).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: MECoastie
Reviews.Content: A Super 8 in the heart of Chinatown. The hotel was modern, fairly clean and the midst of a business street in Chinatown. The front desk was a bit brusque and check out could have been a bit smoother but all in all, the best Super 8 we've ever stayed in... Breakfast is included and is very nice. The rate is reasonable. Parking was a bit expensive but you are in a city.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy-not for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Caramelle
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. Good location in the Chinatown and easy to reach by tram. However, I have been woke up by my neighboors over my room at 2:00 am. Very bad insonorisation. Moreover, I have been woke up twice around 7:00 am by the fire alarm because of burned toasts in the breakfast room.... I do not recommand this hotel if you are on a business trip and wish a deep sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Amyjess
Reviews.Content: During March Break I stayed at the Super 8 on Spadina with my 3 teenage girls to take in the AGO, the ROM, and Chinatown. The hotel has a great location and is close to subway. It is also very clean and modern. The breakfast room was super convenient. Our room was large and very clean and the beds were comfortable. I would definitely choose this hotel again. The staff was helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Layout and security was poor”
Reviews.Author: joesmoErie_Pa
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young children stayed there one night in April 2010 I only have a few issues that are disturbing to me , first the way the rooms were broken into a maze of short halls and around corners and double halls with exits going different places it was very difficult to figure where to go at first. compounding that was the fact that the internal elevator only went to the 3rd floor and we had to walk up to 4th but another external elevator on the side of the building went from the street to the 3rd floor and with a swipe of a card it will go to the 4th but with out signage it to awhile to figure that out. Also disturbing was the below street parking ramp although a camera and a push button mic was there the sign said "this is not a two way intercom" so I guess they could hear you and see you if you had a problem but they didnt have (or want) any way to talk back?? very odd, also odd was the one elevator in use would decend at a real snail pace but no one put it out of service we didnt know and was unsure what was happening and got off after 3 minutes on the next floor. I would go again but I will map out my exits in case of a fire next time. The one stair case exited to a locked store vestibule (before business hours) and the exit door closes and locks with no handle

Reviews.Title: “Such a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dlandr2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to be close to the museum downtown - for the King Tut exhibition. Having shopped around for a good deal, we finally booked with the Super 8 for conveniency of location, and mostly because it was, by far, the most inexpensive. I was expecting a run down establishement (Motel and cheap), but was incredibly surprised by the cleanliness, the very modern look and the hosppitality of the staff. Breakfast in the morning was as good as a continental breakfast can be. Room service was prompt and efficient. The location was fantastic - smack downtown! All in all, perfect location, very surprising Super8 (in a good way)

Reviews.Title: “A really great deal, convenient to a lot of Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: southoverfarm
Reviews.Content: I was escorting my daughter to a college audition and interview. She wanted to stay in a more lively neighborhood than we did on our last visit to Toronto, so we chose this hotel. It was a great choice! The locations was perfect for us: Chinatown, and nearby Kensington Market, were fun, funky, living neighborhoods that were great for walking around -- we always felt safe. There is a streetcar line just outside the hotel, that can take you to downtown sights, or connect with the underground subway for points north and beyond. We were warmly greeted on our arrival. We got there early in the morning, hoping that they could just hold our luggage for us; but the young woman on duty at the front desk did more than that, she secured a room for us right away. (And on our departure day, the young man at the front desk briskly arranged a luggage hold for us. We had a very quiet room looking out onto a residential block. The beds were high-density foam mattresses, we both slept deeply and well. The room was spacious; we were in a 2 queen room; there was a wall partition between the beds, for a nice touch of privacy. There was a minifridge,microwave and coffee maker in the room, with a small eating area in front of the TV. The bathroom was also spacious, and all appliances worked well. I don't know if there was internet access in the rooms; there was a computer in the lobby for guest use, without any annoying necessary passwords or codes. Just sit down and use it. Their "Super Start" breakast was your basic continental fare. The coffee was good. It wasn't fancy, but it was done well. Potential negatives for someone: the hotel is in a mall, on the third floor, so entry is a tiny bit funky. But there is a sign at street level, and the elevator itself was quite safe. The hallways were lit a little more dimly than one might like, plus there was a rabbit-warren aspect to them. But again, we always felt very safe. It is a great value, and we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good. You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: s_vendi
Reviews.Content: I went for valentines day weekend with my girlfriend. We were planning on staying there for 3 nights and enjoying the weekend together. It was a pretty nice hotel and the location was very good; right in the heart of downtown Toronto. It's in the middle of Chinatown. Subway is really close by, street cars all over. Close to Rockwood night club; we went there the first night we stayed. The hotel amenities were very nice. The room we had was a pretty big room for just the two of us. Very comfortable bed; King size bed; we had no trouble sleeping, very comfortable stay and the price was well worth it. The only two things that bring down the rating is the service and the maid/cleaning service. When we got there, we were greeted by this very unfriendly staff person who wasn't helpful at all. We asked for extra sheets and he took 10 minutes to bring them to us and they were the wrong size. So the next time, he took another 20 minutes. Anytime we asked him for something, he'd be very unhelpful and would not greet us in a friendly manner. The maid service was no better. The first night we slept in, so didn't get our room cleaned (which is ok, I don't blame them for that). The next day we specifically left earlier to make sure our room got cleaned. They didn't even change our sheets! All they did was make the bed and clean the bathroom. We slept int he same sheets we used all weekend. Luckily we had extra sheets, and used those on top of the old ones. All in all, I would recommend this place is you're looking for a short stay in a comfortable and affordable hotel. Especially if you wanna stay in the downtown area near the nightlife. It's worth the money. Basically, as I said before, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: HappycamperzOntario
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights and was impressed with the cleanliness and friendliness of front counter staff. Sheets were changed daily and food in the breakfast area was always fresh. Front desk staff were very friendly, especially for the lady who helped us with our reservations. Hotel even kept our luggage for us during our checkout day while we went out for lunch. Will be returning there in the near future and highly recommend long or short stays here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: KHAN_25
Reviews.Content: I was a bit anxious to find out whether the hotel actually was how it seemed on teh internet from UK and pleased to say Super 8 downtown exceeded my expectations completely. As soon as we got in the hotel it was very clean and had welcoming staff and may be because it was off season they upgraded our room for free without having to ask. Which was great because we had toddler with us so the bigger room was ideal. In the bigger room we got king size bed ( which was fabulous to say the least) a sofa bed for my son, a tv microvawe, safe, fridge and room with an amaizing view of teh CN tower!!! The minuite I walked through the room I was soo happy that our stay was going to be comfortable and clean. Housekeeping was great everyday the room was nice and tidy for when we got back and we could just jump into bed. The staff was very friendly always ready to help and accomodating. I have a 15 months old son who used to make alot of noise but they never complained. The breakfast was great too. Overall well worth the money and I WOULD DEFINATLY RECOMMEND IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Rimala
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the second floor of a shopping centre situated in the heart of Chinatown. The shopping centre is not overly noisy and has little impact on your stay, except that it has a food hall and various useful shops - I had a good 7 dollar haircut. The Chinatown area is bustling and full of good cheap food and general shopping. It is quite near a stop for the hop-on, hop-off bus and not far from a number of tourist sights as well as Downtown. The rooms are fine - but not fancy - and the staff were very helpful. Free internet was available and the breakfast was one of the best we had anywhere on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not like other Super 8s!”
Reviews.Author: dagny70
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise this hotel was. And it was a hotel, not a motel. Fantastic location in the heart of China Town, but with Kensington Market and trendy Queen Street close by. Tram stop right outside the hotel making travelling around very easy. Free breakfast was great - juice, tea/coffee, cereal, fruit, bagels/toast. All you need to get a good start to the day. Free coffee all day in lobby and rooms, free internet access in lobby. Staff very helpful. Despite other reviews, it is not a difficult place to find, once you know it is in a small mall. We had a massive king size room, very quiet and clean, with a view of the CN tower! Decor very light and minimalist, lovely!

Reviews.Title: “I still dream of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HazeGrayGardener
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Super 8 Toronto this month, and it exceeded my expectations! It was the cheapest I could find, $420 airfare + 4 nights booked in May. Pearson International Airport is out of the way of down town, so a Bus, Subway, and Streetcar are needed to get to the hotel if you want to do it cheap. (Take the Airport Rocket to Kennedy Station, then take the Green Bloor-Danforth line to St. George Station, and the Spadina Station (Or any street car that says Spadina, for that matter) Streetcar from there will get you almost to the front door of the hotel. The cost is $2.50, and the ticket transfers the whole way). Otherwise you're looking at an $18 shuttle that will only get you there 30 minutes faster. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was too early to check in, but they happily held my bags while I took the chance to explore. Check in was easy, and the front desk staff was courteous and very helpful in giving directions. The room was spacious and clean with a king bed, TV, microwave and safe, plus the coffee maker and usual accoutrements. The view was wonderful, directly facing Spadina with a good view of the CN tower from my window on the 3rd floor. A cursory inspection led me to remove the bedspread and throw it in the corner where it stayed the entire week (I always leave the Do Not Disturb sign up, for security and because I don't want my toothbrush used to clean the toilet). The blanket and sheets were clean and very fresh (I love the hotel sheet smell), and the mattress was very comfortable (a pillowtop). I slept great the whole week, which is very rare for me when staying in a hotel. The room configurations differ, but I was given a desk as well as a classy looking luggage table. The room was clean, other than the greasy(?) bedspread, which I was happy about. Bathroom amenities are surprisingly of good quality and front desk staff were happy to give me more throughout my stay. Breakfast was sparse, continental style, but we're staying in the Super 8, not the Embassy Suites. No made to order omelette aux champignons, but good coffee, juice, muffins, bagels, cereals, oatmeal and spreads. It was filling and I had no complaints. If you are worried about security, there is a desk attendant 24/7 but I never felt unsafe in that area or hotel. A fitness center is advertised as an amenity with this hotel, but when I tried to use it I found the door locked. You may need to ask for a key to get in, but it wasn't a big deal for me so I didn't raise the issue. For a dinner out, I strongly recommend Laksa, a Thai restaurant a few doors down going north. It was excellent! This hotel may not be the Intercontinental (which is farther from downtown, imo), but I was in the Navy and have slept in much worse conditions. The Super 8 was almost luxurious! For the money, it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good value..some good and some bad”
Reviews.Author: corinascot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in June. This hotel is in the heart of Chinatown. The hotel is quiet for being in such a busy area, but we were on the 5th floor. I'd changed the dates on our reservation and they didn't have a reservation for us. I had all my confirmations, ane we got a room, but it was confusing for awhile. The room was fine. It was a simple, clean room with microwave and fridge. Everything seemed fairly new. Our view was awful. We looked out on an a/c unit and across to somepretty ratty looking aparment balconies. Getting into the hotel could be a bit of a hassle. There was one slow elevator activated by your room key. Often took several swipes. The stairs were locked, so you had to use the elevators. The breakfast was free, but not so great. A couple cereals, juice, coffee, bad bagels and packaged muffins, toast. But better than nothing. The location was central, but we decided that the transportation system in Toronto is so terrific and cheap, that next time we came, we'd stay a little further out in a quieter neighborhood. The best thing about this hotel was the price, of course. I think we paid $90.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - time for Toronto to settle the trash strike”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Bettan
Reviews.Content: Great location for our visit to see the Red Sox play the Blue Jays. Staff was friendly, breakfast ok, room no frills but a good value.

Reviews.Title: “very good place”
Reviews.Author: matsMontreal
Reviews.Content: very nice place, very clean and well located in Toronto. We got a very good price from internet. The breakfast is ok. nothing fancy but for the price everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Adds to expierence of visiting Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Cshifty
Reviews.Content: The rates and location are the main reasons we stayed for two nights. Yes it's on top of a Chinese shopping centre but it just added to the experience of visiting Toronto. Felt like you were in a different country, but in a good way. Staff was great, beds were comfy. View isn't the best. Was unable to have breakfast since we had late nights but if we're back again in Toronto we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a crapy mall”
Reviews.Author: kortxopan
Reviews.Content: If you able to deal with a disgusting smell of chinese spices coming from the mall where the hotel is situated, this is definetly your hotel!!! The hotel is great, trust me, and it is quite close to the center, but if only they had put it in the next bulding... Anyway I recomend this hotel. We had a regular room booked but due to a overbooking we were given a jaccuzi one. The room was great, really cleaned but with no views. The breakfast was just ok but always remember the low cost of the room. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “HARD BEDS!! Otherwise a great value. Clean, cheap, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: M1styDawn
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work. I normally stay at Courtyard Marriotts or Hampton Inns, occasionally a Ramada. I have fairly high expectations of hotels since I have to live in them for a week or more each month. I'm not a snob, but I don't settle for a room that is filthy or a bed that is too uncomfortable to sleep in. I hope that gives you some context for my review. This Super 8 is right in Toronto's Chinatown district. It clearly caters to a mostly Asian customer base. This hotel was almost brand new when I stayed in it for leisure. It was very quiet and very clean. The rooms were small but not cramped. The staff were very polite, but did not speak very much english. The parking was a bit inconvenient and expensive ($20!), but not any worse than the rest of downtown Toronto. The room rate was the cheapest downtown by a good amount (maybe $50!). Definitely a good value for the dollar. BUT, the beds are rock hard. This hotel is part of a larger building that houses a shopping mall that resembles a very cramped flea market inside. Our second floor room had a very large window that faced into the building, overlooking the first floor of the mall. The escalator was literally a couple feet from our window running parallel to it. It deposited people on the second floor directly outside of our window. It didn't feel very private, but when the drapes were closed it was no big deal. And when the drapes were open the people watching was really amusing!!! Weirdest view I have ever had from a hotel window, thats for sure. MY BIG WARNING about this place: I can't find words to express how HARD he beds are. When I stayed there they did not have any optional mattress pads or anything to help soften the mattress. I hope they have some by now, but I have no idea. I even took the comforter and folded it triple underneath me and it was still too hard for me to even lay comfortably for a few minutes. I honestly think the carpeted floor would have been softer. Before this trip I wouldn't even have believed they made mattresses this hard. I literally lay awake all night. I have never had a worse night's rest. To be fair, my boyfriend and a few male friends all slept alright on those beds. They did complain that the beds were rock hard, but they still slept. I think anyone without a curvy shape would be ok. Unfortunately I have lots of curves, and I found that the bed had my spine bent out of shape no matter how I lay. We were scheduled to stay in this hotel for 2 nights, but had to check out early and move to a different hotel just because of the hard mattresses. I was very bummed about that because other than the mattresses it was really a fantastic value. I would recommend it to anyone that can sleep on an uncarpeted floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hote;”
Reviews.Author: Tedlooney
Reviews.Content: My teenage son was travelling with us so I had booked a suite at the hotel expecting a suite to mean two seperate rooms. Unfortunately the suite was a single room and although it was a huge room there was a lack of privacy. Apart from this disappointment, I found the Super 8 to be a good hotel. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and really helpful. Breakfast was simple but adequate. The hotel is in a good location with many attractions within easy walking distance. To get to other parts of the city there is a streetcar stop right outside the hotel and the public transport in Toronto is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mizz_gee
Reviews.Content: My family and I drove 8 hours to Toronto and checked into the Super 8 on Spadina Rd. to be awoken at 4AM to the discovery of BEDBUGS on not one, but BOTH beds in our room. After notifying the front desk, I was told that there was nothing he could do until the manager arrives at 9am.,,,,,,and my conference starts at 8am. Be sure that I will be asking for full refund, reporting this to the Toronto Public Health/Health Inspector and staying somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-- shame about the after-hours club”
Reviews.Author: cloobot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overall lovely for the budget traveler-- clean, in a reasonably good location, and excellent value for the money. But WARNING, some of the rooms are above a loud after hours club, that goes until 5am on a Saturday. Unless you can sleep through booming bass all night, you might want to ask for a room on the east side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: scdillon
Reviews.Content: this place is amazing. i used to live in toronto, so i can say with all confidence that this hotel is a rare find for what you pay. i paid 90$ canadian, got a simple room: 2 queen beds, fridge/microwave, cable tv, great bathroom. excellent deal. service was extremely friendly - i felt entirely taken care of. there were like... 4 long black hairs in the bath, but *shrug* nothing you can't wash out with a run of the shower. although it is strange that it's on top of a mall in the middle of chinatown - i found that to be rather charming. i did a little shop in the afternoon and there are fantastic deals!!! i was uber satisfied. and for those of you who said you felt unsafe in chinatown at night - you're crazy!!! yeah there's a few homeless folk hanging around the streets. what do you expect? you're in a big city! you're on a main road - spadina, lots of traffic, nice and busy... unless you're stupid and hanging out in dark alleys, you're safe. i would recommend this place to anybody looking for a nice, simple, clean and quiet stay in the big city!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, convenient, cheap”
Reviews.Author: celibrum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Super 8 for 2 nights in late February with a friend of mine. We were just visiting Toronto. We did not spend much time at the Super 8... only evenings. It was well positioned in downtown. Walkable to Queen Street, Yonge Street and Bloor Street. Not short walks but very walkable. I didn't use any of the public transportation so I don't know how well placed it is in relation to train stops but it's on a main street, Spadina, and in the middle of Chinatown. At night, the area around the hotel felt somewhat shady because the streets were pretty empty and somewhat dirty but it was not terribly uncomfortable. The hotel is inside a mall-ish complex so the elevator is accessible by anyone. There's no doorman or guard to watches who enters the elevator although it's probably surveyed electronically. To access you room's floor, you had to swipe your room card, which prevented people who aren't staying in the hotel from accessing hotel floors. However, I was uncomfortable going to my floor if anyone else was on the elevator. Free wifi in the lobby. You sign out an ethernet wire for internet in your room. Clean and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Tis' truely in the heart of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: FreezingInMN7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of a meeting that was located at the hotel. It was a little strange parking underground and going to the 3rd floor lobby of the hotel. No problems though as it seemed pretty secure. Their is a mall in the center of the hotel that doesn't really bother as the stores open at 10 or 11 and close at 8 so not much noise. The rooms were spacious and pretty clean. The carpets could maybe use some updating but overall the room was nice, king sized bed was very comfortable. Continental breakfast was basic but included so no complaints. While there is a small bar located in the hotel it is more like going to a counter, ordering a beer and watching them pull it from a fridge and then charging you $6 for it. More less a counter with a big screen tv on the wall. The location is right in the middle of Chinatown so there are a lot of Asian restaurants all over. Some very good, others are small diners. If you walk about 6 blocks you hit Queen street and will find bars and more traditional dining. The food was excellent all around. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Rob020
Reviews.Content: I think you will struggle to find a better value hotel. Location is a little strange above a shopping centre in China Town, though only a 15 minute walk from the CN tower and downtown. Staff very helpfull Good gym, free simple breakfast and Internet access No complaints at all, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: BumblebeeVancouver
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel for my parents who were traveling with their 60+ yr old friends. After searching around and finding hotel in the downtown area about $150 for tourist level hotels, I stumbled on reviews about this hotel. The rate was $118.00 in September, but I also managed to book it for a seniors rate at $110.00 which is a great price. I happened to be able (at last minute) arrange my sales trip in Toronto and stayed with them for a few nights. The hotel location is right in the middle of Chinatown between Dundas and Queen Street on Spadina. Perfect location to catch the street car to Yonge Street or walkable in 20 minutes. Also very close to Kensington Market. If you love asian food, this is a great location as there are plenty of options in the area or ventured to Queen street for streetside cafes. The rooms are spacious and clean (clean being the most important of all). The front desk agent mentioned they've only been opened for a year. Amenities were basic, so if you can't live without a specific brand of shampoo or bath wash, make sure you bring your own, as they have a generic Super 8 one. Room are equipped with microwave, minifridge, coffee maker and work table. Not much closet space or dressers, so if you're staying long, you'll have to literally live out of your suitcase. The main lobby is on the 3rd floor. The elevator is off to the side of the mall, which is on the lower floors of the hotel. The hotel itself is only about 3 floors, with some rooms overlooking the mall. Our room was on the 5th floor looking out onto Spadina, with a view of downtown and CN tower. There's a small gym and a dining area where they have a help yourself continental breakfast. There's one computer with internet in the lobby to use, for free. The dining area sits about 30 people so you may have to wait for a table. Breakfasts consists of a variety of cereals, toast, bagels, croissants, coffee, tea, orange and apple juice. Nothing spectacular but it's included so no complaints from me. You do need a key card to go up to your floor (with the exception of rooms on the 3rd floor), so security is pretty good. The area felt very safe, even walking back from dinner at 10:30 at night. The staff were not overly polite but were not rude. I guess indifferent would be a good way to describe them. Overall I would say it was a decent and good stay. It's not exceptional if you compare with a 4-5 star full service hotel but if you're looking for something basic as a hub for exploring the city and don't require the use of any hotel facilities (spa, pool etc.) then this is good value for your dollar. It's not in the heart of the shopping district but certainly close by transit or walkable if you don't mind walking. When I was booking the hotel, I checked all the prices (Expedia, Orbitz, etc.) and found that booking directly was still a better price as they had AAA rates and seniors discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, great location”
Reviews.Author: FrankenMeg
Reviews.Content: Since we entered the hotel through a back entrance, we didn't realize how it was set up until after we had checked in and gotten settled. It's actually situated on the third floor of a Chinese mall. Once you get over the strangeness of staying at a mall, it's actually cool. During business hours, the mall is bustling. We enjoyed poking around the various shops and stalls. The hotel itself is clean and well-appointed. The people working the desk are nice enough. There is Wi-Fi available in the lobby area, which we took advantage of frequently. We lucked into getting one of the only (if not the only) 2 bedrooms in the whole place. It was clean and spacious and exceeded our expectations of a Super 8. The location was great for our purposes. It is right in the middle of Chinatown, and while it gets a little sketchy late at night, it is close to downtown, and is only a couple blocks away from a lively shopping and bar scene. There is also a cable car stop pretty much right in front of the place, allowing access to public transit for further exploring. If we ever find ourselves in Toronto again, we will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location downtown in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: devoureroftheearth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the downtown areas - I just walked to everything. The price is good as opposed to brilliant but you can't get better without getting into a hostel or university setting. There are a lot of great and authentic places to eat in China Town.
