The staff were friendly and helpful, there is a computer with internet in the lobby and for laptops you need a connection lead which you can get from a store in the mall (which the hotel is basically built into). I bought one from the front desk for $5. It's better than wi fi because you always have a strong signal. There is a coin operated laundry in house which was very useful. The free breakfast was ok - bagels and coffee and cereal etc. My room was quiet and there was no 'china town smell'. In terms of cleanliness the cleaners had missed a few things and I would describe it as adequate, not spotless. There was an in room safe, air con, phone, TV. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price, stayed to see REDSOX!”
Reviews.Author: Jubes56
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay at Super 8 in Toronto Chinatown. Great location if you like to explore city. Close to ball park for baseball games. Chinatown in Toronto is huge, and has many restaurants and shops. Entertainment district also only about 10 min walk. Only negatives are elavators are slow, and you can't use stairs (only for emergencies) so you do wait at times. Also, location has some homeless around area, but we never felt uncomfortable, infact we enjoyed the very diverse area in Chinatown. I would stay there again, and recommend this hotel for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: BranSpan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in the Chinatown Center (a mall). We didn't shop in the mall at all, but there are many little shops steps away from the hotel. Kensington market, Rogers center, Eaton's center, etc. are all nearby. Staff were pleasent, rooms were clean and nice, did not hear any noise from the mall in our room. Overall, it was a great place to stay, great location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: frogsinthecreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the location to be very central to all the things we wanted to visit. There was a minor problem when we arrived in that our room was not available to check-in due to some problem with the delivery of linens. The staff was very apologetic. We left our luggage and went out walking around Chinatown for awhile and the room was ready on our return. As others have said, this hotel is unusual in that it is the third floor of a mall with many small shops. The parking was underneath on the third level down. We did not bother with the in/out parking pass since we didn't plan on driving anywhere. The fee was $14/day for all day parking. The room was fairly spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and there was a small refrigerator and microwave in the room. We brought our own ethernet cable for direct hookup to the internet. The wireless capacity was very limited from our room. Breakfast was decent with 5 cereal selections, packaged Sara Lee blueberry muffins, bagels and toast. There was also coffee, OJ and apple juice. It was very busy in the small eating area and we had to wait to get a seat. We were able to walk to Kensington Market, Little Italy, University of Toronto, Bata Shoe Museum and ROM (this was a long walk). Also we walked to the CN Tower, Eaton Centre, and Rogers Center. We also took a Hippo tour which was a lot of fun. For a clean room in a central location, the Super 8 is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “interesting location in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: KarenGH
Reviews.Content: The Super 8 is in a building which houses Chinatown stores in its first few levels. If you have an inside room you can see the stores from across the atrium courtyard. Interesting set-up! The room was clean and modern although there were some little problems...the A/C did not work, the TV remote did not work. Also parking is quite expensive ($19, although it allows in and out priveleges). But if you like to walk around and see interesting Chinatown stores you're right in the middle of the authentic action. The breakfast was a standard "extended continental" buffet with toast, juice, coffee, pastries, cereal. Fruit and eggs would have been nice but they weren't offered. Overall this is a good choice for downtown Toronto considering the price paid and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, but quite pleasant”
Reviews.Author: fairbanks2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a few days to go somewhere that didnâ€™t require a lot of travel (we live in NJ), and Toronto seemed like an intriguing alternative to the shore, since itâ€™s a one-hour flight. We were not disappointed. The Toronto public transportation system is excellent and a great value. One $9 pass allows either a family or two adults access to all public transportation (on weekends). Consequently, we took a bus, train and finally a streetcar to our hotel, saving about $35 on cab fare and feeling like adventurers. By the way, before I continueâ€”one piece of advice. We exchanged American currency for Canadian at the airport for a fee. You can largely avoid this if you have an ATM card with prius because there are banks all over Toronto that accept your card. Anyway, the hotel is in the middle of Chinatownâ€”literally. It is above three floors of flea market, making itâ€¦unusual. But once you get past that it is a quiet, clean hotel for about half the cost of many of the marquee names and the location is excellent. You are right by Kensington square (which is like a 70â€™s street fair/flea market) and a quick streetcar ride from the lovely University of Toronto campus, the waterfront at lake Ontario, or many of the other things to see in this incredible city. If you want to spend the money or are looking for a large, impressive hotel with expansive lobby, bar and restaurants, this is not the hotel for you. It is, I must say, unusual to come home to a largely deserted Chinatown every night to go to your room. It is safe, though. But if you are looking a quiet, clean home base to return to after a dayâ€™s excursions, it is an excellent value and worth the curious location.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinz
Reviews.Content: For the price this is not a bad hotel. The rooms are not very well lit. The corridors are very hot and stuffy. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the CN tower and other great places to visit. The housekeeping was OK, although the coffee machine was not emptied and the carpet was stained in places.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Hailes family
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Super 8 Toronto Downtown, Spadina Ave, for five nights at beginning of July 2008. Overall our experience is that if you accept the limitations, the hotel is reasonable at its price-point. We had two rooms, one a king, the other a double-double. The king (8323) was one of the rooms on the lobby level (the third floor, with the shopping centre occupying the first two) that look down into the atrium of the shopping mall, and was actually the worst of them as the internal escalator from the mall to the hotel passed right outside our window - see picture. For other readers' benefit, the rooms that face the atrium are 8323/5/7/9, 8331/8, 8340/2/4/6, 8350/1/2/3/4. Although initially unhappy with this allocation, we realised the benefit is that it is incredibly quiet when you are sleeping as the mall is closed. We simply never opened our curtains so no-one could look in. The air-con in this room was relatively quiet in operation with the fan set to low, and although normally a light sleeper I got good nights' sleep each night with the air-con left on. The second room (8324) looked out over a side street and was very spacious. I think on balance that as a couple, we would have preferred the bed size limitation of a double compared to a king for the extra room space. Walking round the hotel corridors on the lobby level (we didn't manage to get to the 4th or 5th floors where there are other rooms) we were aware of the fact that there were strange smells in the corridor around the high numbered rooms (about 8340 and above). I have no idea whether this relates to comments by others about the smell in the rooms but these rooms are above the main part of the mall, which may be relevant. The breakfast is inclusive, a do-it-yourself cold buffet with disposable plates, cups & crockery in a small area with stainless steel seats & tables. Plenty of cereal, breads, bagels and croissant, yoghurts, tea, coffee & juices. Very few tables so a fight for space at times. It is perfectly OK but not luxury standard. Is the hotel safe to walk round ? We walked in and out of the hotel at various times of day and night and never felt threatened, but overall we found Toronto had more down-and-outs and beggars than other cities we visited in a six location visit to North America, so don't expect to visit Toronto without meeting vagrants. Because Toronto has banned smoking in public places you will find people from the shopping mall gather outside the hotel entrance but at no point did anyone openly beg for money there - though this did happen in other parts of Toronto we visited. The biggest disappointment for us - and this seems consistent with other recent comments - is the poor quality of customer care. There were several defects with the room when we arrived -clock, fridge and microwave not plugged in, remote control for air conditioning not provided (air-con in atrium and outward facing rooms were different), rooms poorly serviced during our stay, bed covers stained by previous occupants, and a long delay at check-out even at 6.15am. Maybe the pre-dominantly Chinese community that work at this hotel have not adopted the service ethic that Westerners are expecting in an hotel ? There was free wireless (802.11g) internet access in the lobby area and free wired internet in the rooms - take your own RJ45 lead, though. The coin operated laundry was a benefit to a family of 4 on a three-week North-American visit - no soap powders sold there, though, so had to purchase a larger quantity than was needed from one of the chinese market shops that are in the vicinity. Would I stay there again ? At its price-point, yes; but I would probably spend a bit more for a Toronto location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mrobin03
Reviews.Content: In Chinatown and central(walking distance) to everything!! Free internet in lobby and great/clean hotel and decent breakfast that was free!! Would most def stay again!! Room was very large and for being in Chinatown(which stunk horribly) the rooms didn't have the odor at all!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money I guess...”
Reviews.Author: Kikisweets
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel as it was so close to many of the sights we wanted to do during our short trip to Toronto. We are a family of 5 ( 3 young boys aged 7,8,10) So we need a room that will accomodate us all and still give us room to move about. Our room had plenty of space for us to move around and not feel cramped at all! We arrived in downtown T.O. and easily found our hotel. Parking is in an underground lot attached to the building that hosts the hotel. Tell them when you check in that you have a vehicle so they can give you a pass for in and out access. Our room was a good size and the furniture was in good shape. However, there is limited drawer space with only two small drawers to hold your clothes. The room was semi clean, we have a child with a nut allergy so we usually scan the room upon arrival. Obviously the family before us had small children as we found our room covered with stickers on lamp shades, door handles, lamps and even on the toilet and fridge! The floor was not vacuumed, but do they really still do that at hotels? The floor was sprinkled with oreo cookie crumbs and other various crumbs that would stick to your feet as you walked bare foot. The bathroom floor had dirty shoe marks on the tile that left a shoe imprint like someone had walked on a wet floor with dirty shoes. The hallways smelled like the outside of over heated veggies from the market stands or garbage on the streets. Am I fussy, well I guess I am but I really hate when places are listed as clean but you cannot let your kids sit on the floor to put on their shoes. I guess the part that bothered me the most was that the fridge in the room did not cool down, so the food we had for snacks did not stay cold unless we put ice in the fridge. Hmmm. We were able to walk to most places easily and that was a sure bonus, we even were daring enough to walk after 11 pm from the Roger's Centre without any real fear of danger. Are we stupid? Probably so! One of our little guys stubbed his toe on the fold out couch one night and I went to the front desk for a bandaid or some first aid supplies. I sat in the lobby for 30 minutes. There was no one on the desk in that time, and soon many people we gathering, waiting for a person to come to the desk. Finally, when they returned I asked if they had an alcohol wipe and a bandaid to clean up his foot. I was told that I should have brought my own first aid kit, and that they did not give out alcohol of any kind especially a wipe... and then asked what a bandaid would do for a stubbed toe anyways? Hmm let me see...clean up the blood that was on his foot/cut and maybe even take the stain out of the carpet that he made upon impact with the couch. In the end we ended checking out a day early. We found the airconditioning very loud and we could not sleep with the noise. The Air conditioning is located directly beside the bed under the window. Aprox 1-2 feet from the bed and it was so loud that we could not even hear the television over it! In all would I stay there again? Most likely no. I think I would spend a few more dollars and stay closer to attractions, and have a more luxurious room. However, for families that require more room, this is a wonderful place. Just bring your ear plugs for the noise, first aid kit for the boo boos, and a cooler if you plan on bringing any food needing to be kept cold.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice...”
Reviews.Author: 2mnychoices
Reviews.Content: I always look to tripadvisor to help me figure out where I should stay. I have never been steered wrong until now. I can't believe that the hotel I stayed at is the one that got good reviews from other members. The 1st issue was the location. I travel in many cities including NYC without any problem and I must say that this area made me feel very unsafe. While all other areas of Toronto that I traveled in did feel very safe, I can't say that about Chinatown. It's dirty and is a major hangout for homeless people. There were always about 5 homeless people hanging out and sometimes begging about 10 feet from the hotel entrance. At night they squeegie people's car windows (without asking 1st and then expecting people to pay ofcourse). I would always take a taxi back and have them drop me off right in front of the hotel. I would hurry in, but felt very unsafe because in order to get to the hotel, you 1st must go into a vestibule area (with no hotel staff) and wait for the elevator to leave the isolated area. The hotel lobby is on the 2nd floor. The 2nd issue is the cleanliness. I can't believe the # of reviews that claims it is new and sparkly. No way! It's dingy and the carpeting is very stained. Once inside the room, even thouh the carpets are somewhat stained, the sheets and bathroom were clean. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Superior Standard”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: Super 8 Toronto was a find. The hotel is in China Town and an easy walk to downtown Toronto. The hotel is modern, clean and very well maintained. Great breakfast and free Internet in Lobby. Hotel stores luggage and is helpful with advice. No noise issues even though facing main road. For the price, this property is unbeatable in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: HairyO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent find. The hotel iabove a Chinese shopping mall so some rooms look out onto this but it closes early and thick net curtains are in the rooms. The rooms are very new and kept clean. The air con is powerful enough for these large rooms and the beds very comfortable. The location is very near to a tram stop that runs along Spadina Ave. from one metro station to Union station at the other end crossing numerous other bus and tram stops. Even without the public transit most of downtoen Toronto is an easy walk away. Superb value for the quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LizawithaZ
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable hotel in a great location. I walked all over Toronto from this location. Not a great hotel if you plan on spending time in the room (especially since my drapes opened to the inside mall and I didn't want people looking up at me!). But as a "home base", it is wonderful. Friendly counter staff, nice breakfast (cereal, etc), and easy access to all parts of Toronto. Street cars right outside, plus taxi's if needed. As a single woman, I was very comfortable at the hotel and walking (at 6:30 a.m.) to my conference hotel and back at night. As with any city, I did not walk alone after dark, but that had nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: donsyb
Reviews.Content: This is a great value-for-money hotel in downtown toronto. We had room 8413 (a king bed suite) which is huge! Super king size bed, large sofa with 2 x armchairs, dining table and chairs, flatscreen TV, fridge, microwave and desk. It was at least twice the size of any other room we had on this trip, for $160 per night - at a time when the average rate for a standard room everywhere else was $200+ due to conferences. The hotel is new, so everything is still new and shiny, and kept spotlessly clean (especially the breakfast area). We had to pay a refundable deposit in case we smoked or ruined anything (it's all no smoking), which should help to keep it new a bit longer! We also had a view of the CN Tower (an advantage for some but not others). The location is good, a short walk to the bars and cafe's on Queen Street, and 10 mins walk to the entertainment district. We visited most of downtown and didn't use public transport once (although we were lucky as the weather was goegeous). Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive hotel in the heart of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: irdohr
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and clean hotel, with very professional staff. Great value for money, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain for Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SpikeNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights here for a conference where all other hotels were booked. This is not the Four Seasons, but it is tremendous value for the location. Spotlessly clean, friendly efficient front desk staff, quiet, great location. Only downside was no iron in the room, but they quickly provided one when asked.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kwanvin
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. Very nice and helpful staff. Moreover there is a computer with free internet for guests. Hotel's location is in the heart of china town but hotel's lobby located on third floor of china center building so it's a bit hard for first visit traveller to find.

Reviews.Title: “I will recmmand this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Heye
Reviews.Content: How can you ask for more about this newly built hotel. The room 8501 we stayed was a one king bed room with a view of Spadina Ave. The room was so clean and they had even a microwave inside the room. The lobby is modern and nicey designed. The staff at the front desk was always friendly and helpful. For their location with the rate they are offering, this is excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: WjamesV
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Chinatown, located within a mall on top this Super 8 Toronto @ 222 Spadina Ave was my favorite hotel within walking distance to all the different other world areas that Downtown and about can offer and more. Parking is location in a parking garage below though take note it is cheaper to pay the garage fee instead of getting a parking pass via the Hotel. Also there is a addition fee apon checking in ($60-$80) but if you will get that one time fee back but I stayed for a wk so it might only apply for long stay customers. The room we stayed in "8338" was a 2 queen beds (memory foam) with couch, flat screen tv, full bath, all amenities that were listed were included. Our view from room gazed over the inside of the mall but there are 2 other floors that will give a outdoor view. Elevators and escalators provide access into the Hotel. Only drawback is that there was no wifi service it was landlines but if you forget your cables you can simply go to a lower floor and purchase one at the many stores in the mall for a decent price. This Hotel has only been open for 2 months so I am sure that they will improve and streamline everything to make any future visits excellent.
